Articles.Content: There is some mythology in KSP like the Moho description or Bop. But i wonder what it is really like... (feel free to tell your opinon)

Big over the top and filled with explosions,gods that live in the sky that tell the kerbal race to come visit them, kerbulees the kerbal that single handedly traveled to the underworld to repair the great pillar (ahem strut) of the world, and of course the mythical space kraken, the nemesis of the gods.

I would realy like to see more being in the game,a story telling why kerbals are the way they are and perhaps a "moral of the story" that teaches us something deeper besides MOAR BOOSTERS!!!!!!11!1!!

btw i think this belongs to general discushion.
Mythology is a science about old religion i think (or something like that) so... IT SCIENCE! FOR THE MASSES!

Let's say it's a science of history haha. The real astronomy mostly uses mythological names for certain bodies or missions, just like Apollo or Chang'e, and I'd love to see mythological history of Kerbals, hell I'd die to participate writing the story behind them.

Hire me, Squad!
